properties.title: Flühlenmühle
properties.abstract: Since more than 500 years this nostalgic mill has stood at the same point in the wild and romantic Flüebachgraben. And with water wheel and stone, even today onlookers can view the ancient technique in which our ancestors ground flour years ago.
properties.description: Several mills were once in operation in the territory of the municipality of Mühleberg; hence revealing the probable source of its names. However, today the Flühlenmühle mill is the last of its kind in the wild and romantic Flüebachgraben - and a bill of sale dating back as far as 1507 permits us concluding that the Flühlenmühle has been in operation since over 500 years in the very same spot. A foundation has set itself the task of preserving the building and keeping the centuries-old tradition alive, and the stone and wheel continues to grind even today.
